events.message: The customer reported a car accident where their vehicle was hit from behind at a stoplight, causing significant rear bumper damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords related to vehicle collision and damages incurred.
An experienced claims agent specialized in auto accident claims was assigned to handle the case and assist the customer moving forward.
The claim has been officially acknowledged and logged within the system; the customer was notified of claim receipt and next steps.
The customer was asked to provide a copy of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and their insurance policy for further assessment.
All requested documents, including the detailed police report and multiple pictures of the car from different angles, were submitted by the customer.
The claims investigation team began reviewing all submitted documents and statements to verify the circumstances of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer was not at fault and the damage report aligns with the collision described in the police report.
A settlement offer was drafted detailing coverage for the repair costs and any associated rental vehicle expenses during the repair period.
The customer provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the transparent communication and the prompt settlement offer they received.
The claim was officially approved by underwriting based on the investigation findings and coverage terms in the policy agreement.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s preferred bank account covering all approved damages and associated costs without delay.
The claim case was closed successfully after confirming payment receipt and customer agreement that all matters were resolved.
